content.description: This is two pitches long. The first pitch is 60' and 5.8. The second pitch is 50'. The two pitches can be combined with a 70m rope.
content.protection: P1 has 5 bolts plus anchor. The second pitch has 8 bolts plus an anchor. The two pitches can be combined using 17 draws.

content.description:
Begin in the alcove with the overhang, and climb up to the small roof. Big holds on the left get you though and onto varied rock, some requiring a bit of balance. End in a fractured shallow corner to the same ledge as for

Doc Denman

. The route has its own anchor and chains.
content.location:
The route starts to the right of

Doc Denman

in the alcove with a small overhang. The first bolt has a bare stud next to it, both of which have been there for years.

content.description:
Ripple is just right (?) of

Two Shot

.

Climb the prow 15 feet left of

Donahue

. It has a roof down low & real clean rock at the crux.

The first pitch is 5.10a with easy climbing for the first 3 bolts. The second pitch is 5.11a.

Both pitches can be combined with a 70m rope.

This route and

Kahonna Earl

share the first anchor.

Per

JF M

: that this route starts with the left of two adjacent orange-painted angle-iron type hangers.
content.protection:
P1 has 8 bolts + an anchor. P2 has 6 bolts + an anchor.

Per

Ben Bruestle

: I relocated the top anchor up 10 feet higher today to a more user friendly ledge.

It takes two raps to lower with a 70m rope.

content.description:
Micro Dot is a short warm-up.

Per

JF M

: it is first bolted route when coming up the trail and ascends the corner to the right of a black streak (beneath the cave-feature).
content.location: It is on the far right side, down low.

content.description:
Pitch 1 is 5.8 and 80' long. The second pitch is 5.11c and 60' long. Both pitches have 2 bolt anchors.

Both pitches can be combined with a 70m rope.
content.protection: P1 has 8 bolts. P2 has 7 bolts. Both pitches have 2 bolt anchors.

content.description: This can be done with a 60m rope.
content.location: This is the leftmost, farthest up-the-hill climb.

content.description: Donahue is just right of a white pillar.
content.location:
This is right of

Micro Dot

.

content.description:
This is probably the best route on the Tall Green Wall.

Both pitches are 5.10c. The first pitch has a poor belay stance. The second pitch goes to the highest point on the wall. The two pitches can be combined with a 70m rope.
content.protection: P1 has 10 bolts and P2 has 6 bolts.

content.description:
The first bolt has an orange hanger (per

JF M

: this is the right of the two adjacent orange hangers). The first pitch is ~100'. Both pitches have 2 bolt anchors. There might be some loose rock just before the 2nd anchor.

Please note that a single 70m rope will not reach the ground from the 2nd anchor.
content.protection:
P1 has 10 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.

P2 has 7 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.

content.description: Bud Ruble is a two pitches sport climb.  Pitch 1 is 5.8+. The second pitch is the money pitch.
content.protection: P1 has 7 bolts + chains. P2 has 9 bolts + an anchor.
